intro: Cadaba kassasii, commonly known as the Kassasi tree, is a shrub or small tree native to the arid regions of East Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its thick, fleshy leaves and showy, pale pink to white flowers. The plant is well adapted to drought conditions, with deep roots that allow it to survive in poor soil and low rainfall environments. It is often found in rocky areas and is used traditionally for its medicinal properties. The plant's resilience makes it an important component of the local ecosystem.
